content:
# Transportation – Welcome Point

URL: https://wtp.agh.edu.pl/transportation/
Crawled: 2025-03-19 21:24:01

Welcome Point
 > 
Living in Kraków
 > 
Transportation

Transportation

Buses and trams

Where to buy tickets?

Transport tickets can be purchased in many different ways and places:

via various apps, such as JakDojadę, SkyCash, moBILET etc. – it is also possible to but transportation tickets via your bank’s app (e.g. Millenium Bank, Santander Bank…)

at ticket machines at bus stops or on buses/tram → in majority of them you can pay by card, but there are still some old machines on the trams that only takes cash , so it is good to have with you couple of coins

There is no difference between tickets for trams and busses in Kraków – you can use the same ticket for both. 
We have two types of tickets: 
full-price 
(“normalny”) and 
discounted 
(“ulgowy”). In general, students are eligible to purchase discounted tickets, if they have a valid student ID with them. 
Children below 7 years old
 can travel 
free of charge
, as well as primary school pupils.

It is also possible to buy
 a seasonal ticket
 – please find more information about the time frames and prices 
here
.

More information about tickets for transportation in Kraków

Search routes
:

https://jakdojade.pl/krakow/trasa/?locale=en

http://krakow.travel/en/artykul/138/komunikacja-miejska

Prices of tickets: 

https://www.mpk.krakow.pl/en/prices-of-tickets/

Timetables
: 

https://rozklady.mpk.krakow.pl/

Trains

Here you can find all the connections and tickets selling points 
here
.

Cycling

Cycling maps, bicycle racks and self-service bicycle repair stations:

https://ztp.krakow.pl/en/cycling/cycling-maps

Rent a bike or a scooter:

https://escooterstours.com/
Contact – KrkBikeRental
https://www.inyourpocket.com/krakow/recreation/Cycling-and-Bike-hire

Cars and parking

Parking spaces can be found in limited numbers around the institutes of the AGH Univeristy. Parking in the street is partly subject to charge. Please note that not paying the charge may lead to a fine.

Map of the Paid Parking Zone in Krakow

Paid parking zones in Krakow operate from Monday to Saturday, between 10am and 8pm. They are marked as „
P płatny
”.

To pay for the parking, use the dedicated machines or mobile apps – each machine has a sticker showing in which zone you currently are: A, B or C. In each zone, the fare is different:

zone A – 6 PLN / hour

zone B – 5 PLN / hour

zone C – 4 PLN / hour

Please remember to put the printed ticket from the machine behind the windscreen of your car.

 More information 

Tourists who want to plan their own routes in Kraków will find plenty of opportunities to rent vehicles adjusted to their needs. 

More information

Avis +48 22 572 65 20

Carnet +48 601 803 803

Hertz +48 12 285 50 54

Panek +48 509 811 211

Electric car charging stations in Krakow:

There are 40 charging stations for electric cars in Krakow.

You can find them on the map available 
here
.

Taxis

Kraków taxis are reliable and affordable. Alternative taxi services Uber and Bolt are also available. Other local companies include:

Barbakan-iTaxi 
12 19 661
iCar  
12 653 55 55

iTaxi.pl 
737 737 737
Mega Taxi  
12 19 625
